channel.title: Ubuntu doesn't think my monitor can do 1024x768
channel.description: Well I just installed Ubuntu Linux 6.06 as a dual-boot OS alongside windows. It works OK but with one problem: The screen resolution is stuck at 600x800. I tried to change it from the System -> Change screen resolution menu, but 600x800 is the only choice I have. I think it's because Ubunu doesn't think that my monitor is capable of a 1024x768 resolution. How can I fix this?

item.title: Ubuntu doesn't think my monitor can do 1024x768
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

pretty good xorg.conf manual from gentoo:
http://www.gentoo.org/doc/en/xorg-config.xml#doc_chap4

Read full topic
